metadata.title: Tuesday, 29th September, 2015
metadata.session: FIFTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing when the following feeder roads in Mkaika Parliamentary Constituency will be rehabilitated
parts: (a)    Vulamkoko-Mnyamanzi;
(b)    Chinkombe;
(c)    Chimtende; and
(d)    Chimtende-Lupande.

questions.minister: Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry
parts: (a)    how many textile factories were operational in Zambia as of August, 2015;
(b)    how much tax, in percentage points, did the Zambia Revenue Authority collect between September, 2011 and June, 2015 from the following:
(i)    textile factories; and (ii)    imported second hand clothes; and
(c)    what measures the Government is taking to encourage textile industry as opposed to encouraging importation of second hand clothes.
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to construct a One-Stop facility at Chanida Border Post in Chadiza District; and
(b)    if so, when the plans will be implemented.

questions.minister: Minister of Justice when the construction of staff houses at the Shimano Subordinate Court in Nkeyema District will commence.
Minister of Local Government and Housing
parts: (a)    when township roads in Rufunsa will be upgraded to bituminous standard; and
(b)    what the estimated cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how many public schools are in Kalabo Central Parliamentary Constituency; and
(b)    how many schools above, had the following administrators as of 31st August, 2015:
(i)    confirmed headteachers; (ii)    unconfirmed headteachers; (iii)    confirmed deputy headteachers; and (iv)    unconfirmed deputy headteachers.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing when tarring of township roads in Gwembe District will commence.

parts: (a)    how many fish farmers are in Mpongwe District; and
(b)    what incentives, if any, are offered to the fish farmers in the District.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    what the staffing levels at the following primary schools in Chembe Parliamentary Constituency were as of August, 2015:
(i)    Mapula; (ii)    Tande; (iii)    Sokontwe; (iv)    Milulu; and
(v)    Mulumbi;
(b)    which schools were not adequately staffed; and
(c)    when more teachers will be sent to the schools at (b).

questions.minister: Minister of Lands, Natural Resources and Environmental Protection
parts: (a)    how much money was collected, as ground rent, country-wide from 2011 to 2013, year by year; and
(b)    how much money, if any, is still owed to the Government by land owners. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Thanks - His Excellency the President’s Address - Motion (22nd September  - Resumption of Debate.
